title: W3C Immersive Web Working Group-relevant MDN issues
description: Issue filed on MDN Web Docs related to pages attached to technologies developed by W3C Immersive Web Working Group

items.content_html:
For #8736 I did some analysis of tables in Web/API that are coming out too wide in GFM, where "too wide" means > 150 characters.

It turns out that there are a few such tables in the WebXR pages that have already converted to Markdown. I think we might want to consider converting these tables back into HTML. Sorry!

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/xrsession/requestreferencespace (594 chars wide)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/xrreferencespace (594 chars wide)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/xrpermissionstatus/granted (594 chars wide)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/webxr_device_api (342 chars wide)
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/webxr_device_api/geometry (594 chars wide)

I should do the same analysis for JS and CSS and HTTP, since we have only just started considering this problem.
items.title: [webxr] Wide tables in WebXR docs
